name: Latest (planned) agricultural census
description: The year of the last agricultural (crop and/or livestock) census or survey.
source: FAO World Programme for the Census of Agriculture (WCA): www.fao.org/economic/ess/ess-wca/en/; World Bank World Development Indicators Metadata.
laymans-decription: The year of the last agricultural (crop and/or livestock) census or survey.

name: Average income of extreme poor
description: Average income ($PPP) of people living on less than $1.90 a day.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet.
calculation: Average income of exteme poor = poverty line - ( poverty depth * total population * poverty line ).
laymans-decription: Average daily consumption (or income) of people living on less than $1.90 a day (2011 PPP$).
laymans-heading: Average income of those below poverty line

name: Vital statistics from civil registration (births)
description: The percentage of births reported in vital statistics where the data is derived from the Civil Registration system.
source: UNDESA Population and Vital Statistics Report. Data as available at Jan 2014; UNSD Coverage of Birth and Death Registration.
laymans-decription: The percentage of births reported in vital statistics where the data is derived from the Civil Registration system.
laymans-heading: Vital statistics from civil registration (births) (Africa only)

name: Vital statistics from civil registration (deaths)
description: The percentage of deaths reported in vital statistics where the data is derived from the Civil Registration system.
source: WHO African Health Observatory-Civil registration and vital statistics systems.
laymans-decription: The percentage of deaths reported in vital statistics where the data is derived from the Civil Registration system.
laymans-heading: Vital statistics from civil registration (deaths) (Africa only)

name: Climate vulnerability
description: Global adaptation index score of each country's vulnerability to climate change, incorporating exposure, sensitivity and ability to adapt to the negative impacts of climate change. Higher scores indicate higher vulnerability to climate change.
source: Notre Dame Global Adaptation Index (ND-GAIN) vulnerability score.
laymans-decription: Global adaptation index score of each country's vulnerability to climate change, incorporating exposure, sensitivity and ability to adapt to the negative impacts of climate. Source: Notre Dame Global Adaptation Index (ND-GAIN) vulnerability score.

name: Depth of extreme poverty (poverty gap)
description: Depth of extreme poverty (also known as the poverty gap) tells us how far people are from the extreme poverty line, on average per country.
source: World Bank PovcalNet.
calculation: World Bank PovcalNet: http://iresearch.worldbank.org/PovcalNet/povDuplicateWB.aspx.
laymans-decription: From World Bank PovCalNet, representing the average gap for the whole population of each country, with those above the extreme poverty line counted as having a zero gap.

name: Development cooperation
columns: id, year, value, id-to, ha-id-to, delivery-agency, bundle, ecofin-bundle, intl-orgs, sector
description: Detailed breakdown of the characteristics of development cooperation from different providers.
source: Development Initiatives based on national sources. India: Ministry of Finance, Union Budget of India; Mexico: AMEXCID; South Africa: Ministry of Finance, Estimates of National Expenditures.

name: Development Finance Institutions approvals
description: Approvals by bilateral development finance institutions (excluding those reported as ODA or OOFs).
source: Development Initiatives based on DFIs' annual reports and OECD DAC.
calculation: Commitments of ODA and OOFs reported to the OECD DAC are subtracted from totals reported by each institution in their annual reports. Note that data represent approvals/commitments rather than disbursements.

name: Development Finance Institutions approvals to developing countries by financing instrument
description: Approvals by bilateral development finance institutions to developing countries (excluding those reported as ODA or OOFs).
source: Development Initiatives based on DFIs' annual reports and OECD DAC.
calculation: Commitments of ODA and OOFs reported to the OECD DAC are subtracted from totals reported by each institution in their annual reports. Note that data represent approvals/commitments rather than disbursements.

name: Number of people displaced due to human hazards by hosting country
columns: di_id, year, value_1, value_2, value_3, value_4
description: Number of people displaced due to human hazards refers to refugees and people in refugee-like situations, internally displaced persons and asylum seekers.
source: Development Initiatives based on UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and UN Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East.
laymans-decription: Number of people displaced due to human hazards refers to refugees and people in refugee-like situations, internally displaced persons and asylum seekers.
laymans-heading: Number of displaced people due to human hazards

name: Non-grant government revenue
columns: id, year,budget-type, l1, l2, l3, l4, l5, l6, value, value-ncu
description: Non-grant government revenue. Data is for 2015.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Staff reports.

name: Government expenditure by sector
description: Government expenditure by sector.
source: Development Initiatives based on the Ministre de l'economie et des finances (Senegal) and The Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development (Uganda).

name: Education management information system
description: A national administrative system recording data from all education facilities on staff, logistics, performance etc.
source: UNICEF Country Annual Reports: www.unicef.org/about/annualreport/index_82089.html; UIS Data Quality Assessment Framework (DQAF) output: www.poledakar.com/dqaf/index.php?title=DQAF_Events.
laymans-decription: A national administrative system recording data from all education facilities on staff, logistics, performance etc.

name: Foreign direct investment in developing countries
description: Foreign direct investment in developing countries by investors from OECD countries.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Bilateral FDI data source: https://stats.oecd.org/Index.aspx?DataSetCode=FDI_FLOW_PARTNER.Financing-type data sources: Denmark - Denmark NationalBank ( (data cover Danish investment in Africa, Turkey, Mexico, Argentina, Brazil, India, China, Malaysia and Thailand); France - Banque de France (data cover French investment in 43 developing countries that account for around 97% of French investment in all developing countries); Germany - Deutche Bundesbank (data cover German investment in 22 developing countries that represent around 60% of German FDI to developing countries); UK - Office of National Statistics (data cover UK investment in Africa, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico, Panama, China, India, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand); US - Bureau of Economic Analysis.
calculation: Note that negative values, which occur when disinvestments exceed new investments, are excluded here.

name: Foreign direct investment, % of GDP
description: Inflows of foreign direct investment to each country expressed as a percentage of GDP of the same country, each year.
source: Development Initiatives based on UNCTAD Stat and World Bank Development Indicators.
calculation: For each year, data in current prices of inflows of foreign direct investment to each country are divided by the GDP of the country. GDP data is in current US$. Negative inflows of FDI are set to zero.
laymans-decription: Inflows of foreign direct investment expressed as a percentage of the country's GDP.

name: Foreign direct investment per person, US$
description: Foreign direct investment per person (note that negative values, which occur when disinvestment exceeds new investments, are excluded).
source: Development Initiatives based on UNCTAD Stat and World Bank Development Indicators.
calculation: Net inflows of foreign direct investment divided by the total population of each country.
laymans-decription: Volume of financing received from foreign direct investors divided by the country's population (includes equity, loans and reinvested profits). Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: Foreign direct investment per person, US$

name: Number of appearances on ECHO's Forgotten Crisis Assessment index
description: EC's department of Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO) identifies forgotten or so-called 'neglected' emergencies. It has been assembling data for its index since 2004.
source: Development Initiatives based on ECHO Forgotten Crisis Assessment Index.
laymans-decription: EC's department of Humanitarian Aid and Civil Protection (ECHO) identifies forgotten or so-called 'neglected' emergencies. It has been assembling data for its index since 2004.

name: Fragile states
description: Fragile states categories.
source: Development Initiatives based on Fund for Peace Fragile States Index.
laymans-decription: Countries susceptible to state failure risk elements based on twelve primary social, economic and political indicators. The Fragile States Index is produced by the Fund for Peace.

name: Government revenue (excluding grants), % of GDP
description: Government revenue (excluding grants), % of GDP.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.
calculation: Government revenue (excluding grants), divided by GDP in national currency as corresponding to fiscal year.
laymans-decription: Revenue raised as a proportion of national income (GDP) by the government, including tax and non-tax revenue (grants and borrowing are excluded). (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)

name: Government spending per person, 2015 PPP$
description: Government spending per person, 2015 PPP$. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.
calculation: Government expenditure in national currency converted to 2015 constant PPP$, divided by the population of each country.
laymans-decription: Total expenditure by the government divided by the total population. Figures are displayed in 2015 constant purchasing power parity (PPP)$. (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)
laymans-heading: Government spending per person, 2015 constant PPP$

name: Grants, % of government revenue
description: Grants, % of government revenue.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.
calculation: Government revenue (excluding grants), divided by government revenue (including grants) in national currency as corresponding to fiscal year.
laymans-decription: Grants from international donors as a proportion of government revenue (including grants). (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)

name: Health management information system
description: A national administrative system recording data from all health facilities on staff, logistics, performance, morbidity etc.
source: Various, including system providers such as DHIS.
laymans-decription: A national administrative system recording data from all health facilities on staff, logistics, performance, morbidity etc.

name: Human hazard and exposure score
description: Index for risk management score for exposure to human hazards (10 = high exposure).
source: Inform (Index for Risk Management) v 3.0.5.
laymans-decription: Countries that are at risk of conflict or have high current conflict intensity (Inform index component).

name: Humanitarian assistance
description: Humanitarian assistance to each country (including humanitarian assistance reported as ODA).
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC, UN OCHA FTS and UN CERF.
laymans-decription: Humanitarian assistance refers to the financial resources for humanitarian action. It is delivered during and in the aftermath of man-made crises and disasters caused by natural hazards.

name: Gross other official flows received, US$
description: Gross other official flows received, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Other official flows (OOF) are flows to developing countries from donor governments, development finance institutions (DFIs) and multilateral bodies that do not meet the criteria to count as ODA. These are typically loans at low levels of concessionality or finance that is primarily aimed at facilitating exports from the donor country. Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: Gross other official flows received, US$

name: Net other official flows received, US$
International resource flows to and from developed countries
columns: id, year, direction, flow-type, flow-name, value
description: Estimates of international resource flows from developed countries, 2015 US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data of some flows is missing. Development finance institutions: Development Initiatives calculations based on a review of DFIs' annual reports (with flows reported as ODA or OOFs subtracted). Foreign direct investment: OECD. Disbursements of official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook.

name: International resource flows to and from developed countries
description: Estimates of international resource flows from developed countries.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data of some flows is missing. Development finance institutions: Development Initiatives calculations based on a review of DFIs' annual reports (with flows reported as ODA or OOFs subtracted). Foreign direct investment: OECD. Disbursements of official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook.

name: International resource flows to and from developing countries
columns: id, year, direction, flow-type, flow-name, value
description: Estimates of international resource flows into the country, 2015 US$. Estimates are gross inflows where available, with the following exceptions: foreign direct investment and portfolio equity are net inflows (new investments minus disinvestments) and short-term debt is net flows (disbursements minus capital repayments). See methodology for detailed notes on the data for each resource flow.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Note that data on some flows are missing. Official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Foreign direct investment: UNCTAD Stats. Long- and short-term debt: World Bank International Debt Statistics. Portfolio equity: World Bank data bank. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Data.

name: International resource flows to and from developing countries
columns: id, year, dfis-in, fdi-in, fdi-in-profits-out, fdi-out, illicit-financing-out,long-debt-capital-payments-out,long-debt-disbursement-in,long-debt-interest-payments-out,long-debt-net-official-in,net-portfolio-equity-in,oda-capital-payments-out,oda-in,oda-interest-payments-out,oofs-capital-payments-out,oofs-in,oofs-interest-payments-out,pda-in,remittances-in,remittances-out,short-debt-interest-out,short-debt-net-flow-in,ssc-in,ssc-out,trade-mispricing-out
description: Estimates of international resource flows into the country. Estimates are gross inflows where available, with the following exceptions: foreign direct investment and portfolio equity are net inflows (new investments minus disinvestments) and short-term debt is net flows (disbursements minus capital repayments). See methodology for detailed notes on the data for each resource flow.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources. Disbursements and capital and interest repayments on official development assistance and other official flows: OECD DAC. Foreign direct investment: UNCTAD Stat. Outflows of profits on FDI in each country and portfolio equity: World Bank data bank. Remittances: World Bank Migration and Remittances Factbook. Long and short term debt disbursements and capital and interest repayments: World Bank International Debt Statistics. Illicit financing and trade mispricing: Global Financial Integrity program.

name: Total international resource flows, % of GDP
description: Total international resource flows received by each country divided by the country's GDP, for each year.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources (see notes for international resource flows to and from developing countries data).
calculation: The sum of gross ODA, gross OOFs, long-term debt from official sources, long-term debt from commercial sources, net inflows of FDI, net flows of short-term debt, net inflows of portfolio equity and remittances, divided by GDP.
laymans-decription: The sum of official, commercial and private resource flows received by each developing country, expressed as a percentage of GDP.
laymans-heading: Total international resource flows, % of GDP

name: Largest international resource flow
description: The largest international resource flow to each country in each year.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources (see notes for international resource flows to and from developing countries data).
calculation: This indicator is calculated by identifying the largest international resource flow to each country in each year, based on available data on official development assistance, other official flows, foreign direct investment, remittances, long- and short- term debt disbursements and portfolio equity. Observations without data on at least three of four key resources (ODA, OOFs, FDI and remittances) are excluded.
laymans-decription: Largest source of international financing to each developing country.

name: Latest (planned) population census
description: The year of the last population census.
source: UNDESA Population and Vital Statistics Report. Data as available at January 2014.
laymans-decription: The year of the last population census.

name: Latest (planned) household survey
description: The year and type of the last national household survey. Standard survey types: Demographic & Health Survey (DHS); Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS); Household Income & Expenditure Survey (HIES); National Survey (NS).
source: IHSN Survey Catalog; USAID DHS Program.
laymans-decription: The year and type of the last national household survey. Standard types: DHS  Demographic & Health Survey; MICS (Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey); HIES (Household Income & Expenditure Survey); NS (National Survey).

name: Disbursements of long-term debt from commercial creditors
columns: id-to, year, destination-institution-type, creditor-type, creditor-institution, financing-type, value
description: Disbursements on long-term debt from commercial sources.
source: World Bank International Debt Statistics.

name: Disbursements of long-term debt from official creditors
columns: id-to, year, destination-institution-type, creditor-type, creditor-institution, financing-type, value
description: Disbursements on long-term debt from official sources (excluding disbursements reported as ODA or OOFs).
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank International Debt Statistics and OECD DAC.
calculation: To avoid double counting disbursments on ODA loans and OOFs are removed from the reported disbursements of long-term debt from official creditors. ODA loans are subtracted from disbursements of concessional debt to each country; OOFs are subtracted from non-concessional sources (distinguishing between bilateral and multilateral providers in both calculations). Any negative values, where reported disbursements of ODA loans or OOFs exceed reported disbursements of long-term debt, are set to zero.

name: Natural hazard and exposure score
description: Index for risk management score for exposure to natural hazards (10 = high exposure).
source: Inform (Index for Risk Management) v 3.0.5.
laymans-decription: Countries that are exposed to, or are vulnerable to natural hazards (INFORM index component).

name: Government revenue per person (excluding grants), 2015 PPP$
description: Government revenue per person (excluding grants), 2015 PPP$.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.
calculation: Government revenue (excluding grants) in national currency converted to 2015 constant PPP$, divided by the population of each country.
laymans-decription: Average revenue raised per person by the government, including tax and non-tax revenue (grants and borrowing are excluded). Figures are displayed in 2015 constant purchasing power parity (PPP)$. (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)
laymans-heading: Government revenue per person (excluding grants), 2015 constant PPP$

name: Number of poverty surveys in past 10 years
description: Poverty surveys collect data on household income, consumption and expenditure, including income in kind. They typically include income, expenditure, and consumption surveys, household budget surveys, Integrated Surveys, Living Standard Measuring Surveys, and other poverty related surveys.
source: World Bank Statistical Capacity Indicators (2014).
laymans-decription: Poverty surveys collect data on household income, consumption and expenditure, including income in kind. They typically include income, expenditure, and consumption surveys, household budget surveys, Integrated Surveys, Living Standard Measuring Surveys, and other poverty related surveys.
laymans-heading: Number of poverty surveys in past 10 years (Africa only)

name: Number of UN-coordinated appeals
description: Number of UN-coordinated appeals per country since 2000.
source: Development Initiatives based on UN OCHA's FTS.
laymans-decription: Number of UN-coordinated appeals per country since 2000.
laymans-heading: Number of UN-coordinated appeals per country since 2000

name: ODA capital repayments
description: Bilateral data on capital repayments on ODA loans.
source: OECD DAC.

name: ODA interest payments
description: Bilateral data on interest payments on ODA loans.
source: OECD DAC.

name: ODA, % of international resource flows
description: Inflows of gross official development assistance (ODA) to each country expressed as a percentage of GDP of the same country, each year.
source: Development Initiatives based on numerous sources (see notes for international resource flows to and from developing countries data).
calculation: Gross disbursements of ODA received by each developing country divided by the sum of gross ODA, gross OOFs, long-term debt from official sources, long-term debt from commercial sources, net inflows of FDI, net flows of short-term debt, net inflows of portfolio equity and remittances. Observations without data on at least three of four key resources (ODA, OOFs, FDI and remittances) are excluded.
laymans-decription: ODA received by each developing country, expressed as a percentage of all official, commercial and private international resource inflows.

name: Other official flows
columns: year, id-from, id-to, sector, oof-bundle, channel, value
description: Gross OOF.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.

name: Gross other official flows provided, US$
description: Gross other official flows provided, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.

name: Net other official flows provided, US$
description: Net other official flows provided, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Other official flows (OOF) are flows to developing countries from donor governments, development finance institutions (DFIs) and multilateral bodies that do not meet the criteria to count as ODA. These are typically loans at low levels of concessionality or finance that is primarily aimed at facilitating exports from the donor country. Net OOFs are equal to gross OOFs minus capital repayments on OOF loans. Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: Net other official flows provided, US$

name: Net south-south development cooperation provided, US$
description: Net south-south development cooperation provided, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC and national sources.
laymans-decription: Net south-south development cooperation provided by countries that are not members of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC). Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: Net south-south development cooperation provided, US$

name: Number of people living in extreme poverty
description: Number of poor people living on under $1.90 per day.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet.
calculation: Total population * percentage of population living on under $1.90 per day.
laymans-decription: Extreme poverty is defined as living on less than $1.90 a day. It is calculated using the national poverty lines of some of the world's poorest countries at 2011 PPP$.
laymans-heading: Number of people living in extreme poverty

name: Poorest 20%
description: Number of people in each country that are part of the poorest 20% of people worldwide.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet. See our factsheet: http://devinit.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Factsheet-Ending-poverty-by-focusing-on-the-poorest-20-percent-of-people-globally.pdf.
calculation: See our factsheet: http://devinit.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/Factsheet-Ending-poverty-by-focusing-on-the-poorest-20-percent-of-people-globally.pdf.
laymans-decription: Number of people in the poorest 20% of the global population (P20).

name: % of population living in extreme poverty
description: Percentage of population living under $1.90 per day.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet.
calculation: World Bank PovcalNet: http://iresearch.worldbank.org/PovcalNet/povDuplicateWB.aspx.
laymans-decription: Extreme poverty is defined as living on less than $1.90 a day. It is calculated using the national poverty lines of some of the world's poorest countries at 2011 PPP$.
laymans-heading: Extreme poverty headcount (% of the population living in extreme poverty)

name: % of population living on less than $3.10 a day
description: Percentage of population living under $3.10 per day.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank PovcalNet.
calculation: World Bank PovcalNet: http://iresearch.worldbank.org/PovcalNet/povDuplicateWB.aspx.
laymans-decription: Data for those living under $3.10 a day illustrates that while many people are not in extreme poverty (less than $1.90 a day) they are still very poor.
laymans-heading: Moderate poverty rate (% of the population living on less than $3.10 a day)

name: Bilateral remittances
description: Bilateral remittances.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank estimates (Migration and Remittances Factbook).
laymans-decription: The amount of bilateral remittances received in US$.

name: Remittances received per person, US$
description: Remittances per person.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank.
calculation: Remittances received divided by the total population of each country.
laymans-decription: Volume of remittances received in each country divided by the country's population (includes personal transfers and income of workers employed in an economy where they are not resident). Data is in constant 2015 prices.

name: South-south cooperation
description: South-south cooperation.
source: Development Initiatives based on national sources. India: Ministry of Finance, Union Budget of India; Mexico: AMEXCID; South Africa: Ministry of Finance, Estimates of National Expenditures.

name: South-south development cooperation provided, % of GNI
description: South-south development cooperation provided, % of GNI.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC and national sources.
laymans-decription: Development cooperation provided by countries that are not members of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC), expressed as a percentage of gross national income.
laymans-heading: South-south development cooperation provided, % of GNI

name: Statistical capacity
description: The Statistical Capacity Indicator provides an overview of the capacity of a country's national statistical system based on a diagnostic framework thereby assessing three dimensions: methodology, source data, and periodicity and timeliness.
source: World Bank Statistical Capacity Indicators.
laymans-decription: The Statistical Capacity Indicator provides an overview of the capacity of a country's national statistical system based on a diagnostic framework thereby assessing three dimensions: methodology, source data, and periodicity and timeliness.
laymans-heading: World Bank statistical capacity indicator (overall average 2014) (Africa only)

name: Government revenue (including grants), % of GDP
description: Government revenue (including grants), % of GDP.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications.
calculation: Total government revenue from all sources divided by the GDP of each country.
laymans-decription: Revenue raised as a proportion of national income (GDP) by the government, including tax, non-tax revenue and grants (borrowing is excluded). (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)

name: Government revenue per person (including grants), 2015 PPP$
description: Government revenue per person (including grants), 2015 PPP$.
source: Development Initiatives based on IMF Article IV publications and World Economic Outlook.
calculation: Government revenue (including grants) in national currency converted to 2015 constant PPP$, divided by the population of each country.
laymans-decription: Average revenue raised per person by the government, including tax, non-tax revenue and grants (borrowing is excluded). Figures are displayed in 2015 constant purchasing power parity (PPP)$. (Data series is from 1999-2021, where available. The hover function details whether the data point is an actual or a projected figure.)
laymans-heading: Government revenue per person (including grants), 2015 constant PPP$

name: Gross domestic product (current US$)
description: GDP (current US$).
source: World Bank World Development Indicators.

name: Gross domestic product (2015 US$)
description: GDP (constant 2015 US$).
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank World Development Indicators, series code NY.GDP.MKTP.CD.
calculation: GDP at purchaser's prices is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. WB WDI data are in current US$. Dollar figures for GDP are converted from domestic currencies using single year official exchange rates. For a few countries where the official exchange rate does not reflect the rate effectively applied to actual foreign exchange transactions, an alternative conversion factor is used. The values are converted to 2015 constant prices using deflators derived from IMF WEO data.

name: Gross domestic product (current US$) per capita
description: GDP (current US$) per capita.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators.

name: Gross domestic product (2015 US$) per capita
description: GDP (constant 2015 US$) per capita.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank World Development Indicators, NY.GDP.PCAP.CD.
calculation: GDP per capita is gross domestic product divided by midyear population. GDP is the sum of gross value added by all resident producers in the economy plus any product taxes and minus any subsidies not included in the value of the products. It is calculated without making deductions for depreciation of fabricated assets or for depletion and degradation of natural resources. WB WDI data are in current US$. The values are converted to 2015 constant prices using deflators derived from IMF WEO data.

name: Gross national income (current US$)
description: GNI (current US$).
source: World Bank World Development Indicators.

name: Gross national income (2015 US$)
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank World Development Indicators, series code NY.GNP.MKTP.CD.
calculation: GNI (formerly GNP) is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. WB WDI data are in current US$. The values are converted to 2015 constant prices using deflators derived from IMF WEO data.

name: Gross national income (current US$) per capita
description: GNI (current US$) per capita.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators.

name: Gross national income (2015 US$) per capita
description: GNI (2015 US$) per capita.
source: Development Initiatives based on World Bank World Development Indicators, series code NY.GNP.PCAP.CD.
calculation: GNI per capita (formerly GNP per capita) is the gross national income, converted to U.S. dollars using the World Bank Atlas method, divided by the midyear population. GNI is the sum of value added by all resident producers plus any product taxes (less subsidies) not included in the valuation of output plus net receipts of primary income (compensation of employees and property income) from abroad. GNI, calculated in national currency, is usually converted to US$ at official exchange rates for comparisons across economies, although an alternative rate is used when the official exchange rate is judged to diverge by an exceptionally large margin from the rate actually applied in international transactions. To smooth fluctuations in prices and exchange rates, a special Atlas method of conversion is used by the World Bank. This applies a conversion factor that averages the exchange rate for a given year and the two preceding years, adjusted for differences in rates of inflation between the country, and through 2000, the G-5 countries (France, Germany, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States). From 2001, these countries include the Euro area, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. WB WDI data are in current US$. The values are converted to 2015 constant prices using deflators derived from IMF WEO data.

name: Gross national income (current US$)
description: GNI (current US$).
source: OECD DAC.

name: Gross national income (2015 US$)
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.

name: Gross ODA received, US$
description: Gross ODA received, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Gross official development assistance (ODA) includes non-monetary transfers (e.g. food aid, technical cooperation) and ODA that resulted in no additional transfer of resources (e.g. debt relief). Data is in constant 2015 prices.

name: Net ODA received, US$
description: Net ODA received, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Net official development assistance (ODA) includes non-monetary transfers (e.g. food aid, technical cooperation) and ODA that resulted in no additional transfer of resources (e.g. debt relief) minus capital repayments on ODA loans (interest repayments are not subtracted). Data is in constant 2015 prices.

name: Gross ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$
description: Gross ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Gross official development assistance (ODA) provided by each member of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC). Includes non-monetary transfers (e.g. food aid, technical cooperation) and ODA that resulted in no additional transfer of resources (e.g. debt relief) minus capital repayments on ODA loans (interest repayments are not subtracted).
laymans-heading: Gross ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$

name: Net ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$
description: Net ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Net official development assistance (ODA) provided by each member of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC). Includes non-monetary transfers (e.g. food aid, technical cooperation) and ODA that resulted in no additional transfer of resources (e.g. debt relief) minus capital repayments on ODA loans (interest repayments are not subtracted). Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: Net ODA provided by OECD DAC members, US$

name: Net ODA provided by DAC members, % of GNI
description: Net ODA provided by DAC members, % of GNI.
source: OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Net official development assistance (ODA) provided by members of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC), expressed as a percentage of gross national income (GNI).
laymans-heading: Net ODA provided by DAC members, % of GNI

name: Gross ODA provided by DAC members to LDCs, % of GNI
description: Gross ODA provided by DAC members to LDCs, % of GNI.
source: OECD DAC.
laymans-decription: Net official development assistance (ODA) to least-developed countries (LDCs) provided by members of the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC), expressed as a percentage of gross national income.
laymans-heading: Gross ODA provided by DAC members to LDCs, % of GNI

name: ODA excluding debt relief
description: Net ODA with debt relief separated.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC.

name: Share of income of bottom 20% of population
description: Share of income of bottom 20% of population.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20. Percentage share of income or consumption is the share that accrues to subgroups of population indicated by deciles or quintiles. Percentage shares by quintile may not sum to 100 because of rounding.

name: Income share by quintile
columns: di_id, year, value_bottom_20pc, value_2nd_quintile, value_3rd_quintile, value_4th_quintile, value_5th_quintile
description: Percentage of income received by each quintile of the population. Data is for 2015 or most recent year prior.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20, SI.DST.02ND.20, SI.DST.03RD.20, SI.DST.04TH.20 and SI.DST.05TH.20.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SI.DST.FRST.20, SI.DST.02ND.20, SI.DST.03RD.20, SI.DST.04TH.20 and SI.DST.05TH.20.

name: Total population
description: Total population.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.TOTL.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.TOTL. Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates.

name: Population: rural
description: Rural population.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS. Rural population refers to people living in rural areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated as the difference between total population and urban population.

name: Population: urban
description: Urban population.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS. Urban population refers to people living in urban areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated using World Bank population estimates and urban ratios from the United Nations World Urbanization Prospects.

name: Urban vs rural population level
description: Urban vs rural population level.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS, SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.TOTL (total population, number of people), SP.URB.TOTL.IN.ZS (urban population, %) and SP.RUR.TOTL.ZS (rural population, %). Total population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship. The values shown are midyear estimates. Urban population refers to people living in urban areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated using World Bank population estimates and urban ratios from the United Nations World Urbanization Prospects. Rural population refers to people living in rural areas as defined by national statistical offices. It is calculated as the difference between total population and urban population.

name: Population by age group
description: Number of people in each of 3 age bands.
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.0014.TO.ZS, SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS and SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.0014.TO.ZS, SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS and SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS.

name: Population: 0-14 years
description: Population ages 0-14 (% of total).
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.0014.TO.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.0014.TO.ZS. Population between the ages 0 to 14 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population.

name: Population: 15-64 years
description: Population ages 15-64 (% of total).
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.1564.TO.ZS. Total population between the ages 15 to 64 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship.

name: Population: 65+ years
description: Population ages 65 and above (% of total).
source: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS.
calculation: World Bank World Development Indicators, series code SP.POP.65UP.TO.ZS. Population ages 65 and above as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship.

name: ODA per person living on under $1.90 a day, US$
description: ODA per person living on under $1.90 a day, US$.
source: Development Initiatives based on OECD DAC and World Bank PovcalNet.
laymans-decription: Official development assistance (ODA) per poor person, calculated as the total net ODA received by a country divided by the number of people in that country living on less than $1.90 per day. Data is in constant 2015 prices.
laymans-heading: ODA per person living on under $1.90 a day, US$

name: Agriculture allocation as a % of total expenditure
description: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the agriculture sector.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the agriculture sector, by district.
laymans-heading: Agriculture allocation as a % of total revenue

name: Antenatal care coverage rate
description: Antenatal care coverage rate.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: The percentage rate of antenatal care coverage, by district.

name: Average household size
description: Average household size.
source: National Population and Housing Census 2014: provisional results, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: The number of people who normally live and eat together, by district.

name: Centrally raised revenues
description: Centrally raised revenues.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of local government revenue that is funded though central government transfers, by district.

name: Average dependency ratio
description: Average dependency ratio.
source: Profiles of higher (district and municipal) local governments 2014, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: A ratio of people typically not in the labour force (the dependent part) and those typically in the labour force (the productive part). The higher the ratio, the higher the level of dependency.

name: Decent standard of living score
description: Decent standard of living score (higher is better).
source: Profiles of higher (district and municipal) local governments 2014, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: The basic needs for people to have a decent standard of living. The higher the score the better standard of living.

name: Primary education donor spending per child
description: Primary education donor spending per child.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: On-budget donor funded expenditure allocations per child in government primary education, by district.
laymans-heading: Primary education donor spending per child

name: Donor funds
description: The proportion of local government revenue that is funded through donor funding, by district.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of local government revenue that is funded through donor funding, by district.

name: Donor revenues
description: Donor revenues.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of local government revenue that is funded through donor funding, by district.

name: Diphtheria treatment coverage rate
description: Diphtheria treatment coverage rate.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: The average rate of diphtheria treatment coverage, by district.

name: Education allocation as a % of total expenditure
description: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the education sector, by district.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the education sector, by district.
laymans-heading: Education allocation as a % of total revenue

name: National finance
description: National finance.
source: Uganda budget information, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: National finance.

name: Total expenditure per capita
description: Total expenditure per capita.
source: Uganda budget information, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: Total per capita local government expenditure allocations, by district.

name: Primary health spending per person
description: Local government health spending, per person.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: Local government spending to healthcare per person, by district.
laymans-heading: Local government health spending, per person

name: Health allocation as a % of total expenditure
description: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the health sector.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of total local government expenditure that is allocated to the health sector, by district.
laymans-heading: Health allocation as a % of total revenue

name: Approved posts that are filled (%)
description: Approved posts that are filled (%).
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: Proportion of approved health job posts that are filled, by district.

name: HMIS reporting score
description: HMIS reporting score.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: Health Management Information System (HMIS) reporting score, by district. The higher the score the better the rated performance, with 0 the lowest score possible and 10 the highest.

name: Household sanitation coverage (%)
description: Household sanitation coverage (%).
source: Water and environment sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Water and Environment.
laymans-decription: Proportion of the population that has access to improved sanitation facilities, by district.

name: Locally raised revenues
description: Locally raised revenues.
source: Uganda budget information, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of local government revenue that is locally generated, through collection of fees, fines and other local taxation, by district.

name: Tetanus vaccine coverage rate
description: Tetanus vaccine coverage rate.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: The average coverage rate of tetanus toxoid vaccine treatment, by district.

name: Primary leaving exam performance index
description: % of pupils passing the primary education leaving exam.
source: Education abstracts 2010-2013 budget data, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The percentage of pupils that pass the primary education leaving exam, by district.
laymans-heading: % of pupils passing the primary education leaving exam

name: Life expectancy
description: Life expectancy.
source: Profiles of higher (district and municipal) local governments 2014, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: Average number of years that a person can expect to live in 'full health' by taking into account years lived in less than full health due to disease and/or injury. This can be derived for either males or females and is, in most populations, slightly higher for females. Life expectancy is normally determined at birth but can be derived at any other age based on the current death rates.

name: Locally raised revenues
description: The proportion of local government revenue that is locally generated, through collection of fees, fines and other local taxation, by district.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: The proportion of local government revenue that is locally generated, through collection of fees, fines and other local taxation, by district.

name: District league table overall score
description: District league table overall score.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: A composite index based on the performance of all district health indicators. The higher the score the better the rated performance, with 0 the lowest score possible and 100 the highest.

name: Population density (per sq km)
description: Population density (per sq km).
source: National Population and Housing Census 2014: provisional results, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: The population per square kilometre, by district.

name: Poverty headcount
description: Poverty headcount.
source: Profiles of higher (district and municipal) local governments 2014, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: Percentage of people in poverty, in relation to the total population in a given area, based on the national poverty line. It does not take into account the depth of poverty. The data year is given as the document publication date, but is based on estimates from previous household surveys by the Uganda Bureau of Statistics.

name: Primary education spending per child
description: Primary education spending, per child.
source: Local government budgets, Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.
laymans-decription: Total local government expenditure per child in government funded primary education by district.

name: Primary net enrolment rate
description: Primary net enrolment rate.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The number of children of official primary school age who are enrolled in primary education as a percentage of the total children of the official school age population.

name: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-all schools (%)
description: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-all schools (%).
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The percentage of primary school pupils in government and private run educational facilities that have adequate reading and writing space in their classrooms, by district.
laymans-heading: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-all schools (%)

name: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-government schools (%)
description: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-government schools (%).
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The percentage of primary school pupils in government run educational facilities that have adequate reading and writing space in their classrooms, by district.
laymans-heading: Primary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-government schools (%)

name: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-all schools
description: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-all schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The number of pupils per teacher in all primary education schools, by district.
laymans-heading: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-all schools

name: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-government schools
description: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-government schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The number of pupils per teacher in government run primary education schools, by district.
laymans-heading: Primary pupil to teacher ratio-government schools

name: Rural access to safe water (%)
description: Rural access to safe water (%).
source: Water and environment sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Water and Environment.
laymans-decription: Percentage of people in rural Uganda who have access to potable water, by district.

name: Rural water source functionality (%)
description: Rural water source functionality (%).
source: Water and environment sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Water and Environment.
laymans-decription: Access to adequate amounts (20 litres per person per day minimum) of safe drinking water (treated surface water or uncontaminated borehole / protected well water) within a convenient distance from the user's dwelling (within a walking distance of not more than half a kilometre), by district.

name: Secondary net enrolment rate
description: Secondary net enrolment rate.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The number of children of official secondary school age who are enrolled in secondary education as a percentage of the total children of the official school age population.

name: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space (total)
description: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-all schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The percentage of secondary school pupils in government and private run educational facilities that have adequate reading and writing space in their classrooms, by district.
laymans-heading: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-all schools

name: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space (government schools)
description: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space-government schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The percentage of secondary school pupils in government run educational facilities that have adequate reading and writing space in their classrooms, by district.
laymans-heading: Secondary pupils with adequate sitting and writing space (government schools)

name: Secondary pupil-teacher ratio (total)
description: Secondary pupil-teacher ratio-all schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The number of pupils per teacher in all secondary education schools, by district.

name: Secondary pupil-teacher ratio (government schools)
description: Secondary pupil-teacher ratio-government schools.
source: Education statistics abstracts 2010-2013, Ministry of Education.
laymans-decription: The relationship between the number of students enrolled in a school and the number of 'full-time equivalent' teachers employed by the school, by district.

name: Tuberculosis treatment success rate
description: Tuberculosis treatment success rate.
source: Annual health sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Health.
laymans-decription: Percentage of successes among a number of attempts for treatment of tuberculosis, by district.

name: Total population
description: Total population.
source: National Population and Housing Census 2014: provisional results, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: The number of people who live in a district.

name: Urban population (%)
description: Urban population (%).
source: National Population and Housing Census 2014: provisional results, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: Percentage of population living in an urban setting, by district.

name: Urban and rural population (%)
description: Urban and rural population (%).
source: National Population and Housing Census 2014: provisional results, Uganda Bureau of Statistics.
laymans-decription: Percentage of population living in urban and rural settings, by district.

name: District WASH performance score
description: District WASH performance score.
source: Water and environment sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Water and Environment.
laymans-decription: A composite index of all district-level water and sanitation performance indicators.

name: Functioning water source committees (%)
description: Functioning water source committees (%).
source: Water and environment sector performance reports 2010-2014, Ministry of Water and Environment.
laymans-decription: Percentage of water committees that are functioning, by district.

name: Belgian Development Cooperation planned budgets
description: The data shows forward looking budget data reported to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) by Belgium for existing or committed projects spanning multiple years. Budget data is displayed for the Directorate-General for Development only. This visualisation shows only project financing for specific countries: Regional and unspecified funding is excluded.
source: Development Initaitives based on Belgian DG Development data downloaded via the IATI Registry on 15 December 2016.
laymans-decription: Belgian Development Cooperation forward-looking budgets for each country based on activities reported through IATI.

name: Canada, Global Affairs planned budgets
description: The data shows forward looking budget data reported to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) by Canada for existing or committed projects spanning multiple years. Budget data is displayed for Global Affairs Canada only. This visualisation shows only project financing for specific countries: Regional and unspecified funding is excluded.
source: Development Initaitives based on Canada Global Affairs data downloaded via the IATI Registry on 15 December 2016.
laymans-decription: Canada Global Affairs forward-looking budgets for each country based on activities reported through IATI.

name: Denmark, DANIDA and Foreign Affairs planned budgets
description: The data shows forward looking budget data reported to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) by Denmark for existing or committed projects spanning multiple years. Budget data is displayed for DANIDA and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. This visualisation shows only project financing for specific countries: Regional and unspecified funding is excluded.
source: Development Initaitives based on Denmark Ministry of Foreign Affairs data downloaded via the IATI Registry on 15 December 2016.
laymans-decription: Denmark DANIDA and Foreign Affairs forward-looking budgets for each country based on activities reported through IATI.

name: UK, DFID planned budgets
description: The data shows forward looking budget data reported to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) by the UK for existing or committed projects spanning multiple years. Budget data is displayed for the Department for International Development only. This visualisation shows only project financing for specific countries: Regional and unspecified funding is excluded.
source: Development Initaitives based on UK DFID data downloaded via the IATI Registry on 15 December 2016.
laymans-decription: UK DFID forward-looking budgets for each country based on activities reported through IATI.

name: Netherlands, Foreign Affairs planned budgets
description: The data shows forward looking budget data reported to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) by the Netherlands for existing or committed projects spanning multiple years. Budget data is displayed for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs only. This visualisation shows only project financing for specific countries: Regional and unspecified funding is excluded.
source: Development Initaitives based on Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs data downloaded via the IATI Registry on 15 December 2016.
laymans-decription: Netherlands Foreign Affairs forward-looking budgets for each country based on activities reported through IATI.
